clusters.title: Suspects arrested over theft of jewels at Louvre museum in Paris
clusters.neutral_headline: Two Arrested in Connection with Louvre Museum Jewel Heist
bullet_summary: French police have arrested two men in connection with the heist of France's crown jewels from the Louvre Museum in Paris, officials said Sunday
Paris Prosecutor Laure Beccuau revealed on Sunday that suspects were arrested over the theft of crown jewels from the Louvre Museum last weekend
The Paris prosecutor said on Sunday that a number of suspects have been arrested over the theft of crown jewels from Paris' Louvre museum last weekend
French police have made arrests in connection with the heist of France's crown jewels from the Louvre Museum in Paris, officials said Sunday

items.title: Suspects arrested over theft of jewels at Louvre museum in Paris
items.standfirst: Four thieves broke into the world's most-visited museum in broad daylight, stealing eight items worth €88m (£76m; $102m).
items.content: Four thieves broke into the world's most-visited museum in broad daylight, stealing eight items worth €88m (£76m; $102m).

items.title: Two men arrested after Louvre jewel heist
items.standfirst: Two suspects in their 30s detained on Saturday evening in relation to €88m robbery, according to French mediaTwo suspects have been arrested in relation to last Sunday’s heist at the Louvre museum in Paris, in which a gang of four men made off with crown jewels worth an estimated €88m (£76m), French media have reported.The Paris public prosecutor confirmed on Sunday that one man had been detained by organised crime squad officers at about 10pm (8pm UK time) on Saturday at Charles de Gaulle airport in Paris, but did not say how many arrests had been made. Continue reading...
items.content: Two suspects in their 30s detained on Saturday evening in relation to €88m robbery, according to French mediaTwo suspects have been arrested in relation to last Sunday’s heist at the Louvre museum in Paris, in which a gang of four men made off with crown jewels worth an estimated €88m (£76m), French media have reported.The Paris public prosecutor confirmed on Sunday that one man had been detained by organised crime squad officers at about 10pm (8pm UK time) on Saturday at Charles de Gaulle airport in Paris, but did not say how many arrests had been made. Continue reading...

items.content: This is a breaking news story.

items.title: Suspects in Louvre Heist in Custody After One-Week Manhunt
items.standfirst: Suspects have been arrested on Saturday evening and taken into custody as part of the investigation into the spectacular Louvre museum jewel heist a week earlier that gripped the world and embarrassed the French government.
items.content: Suspects have been arrested on Saturday evening and taken into custody as part of the investigation into the spectacular Louvre museum jewel heist a week earlier that gripped the world and embarrassed the French government.

items.title: Two suspects arrested over Louvre museum jewellery heist
items.standfirst: French authorities have made arrests in connection to the recent theft of precious jewellery from the Louvre museum in Paris, the Paris prosecutor said on Sunday. One of the suspects was arrested at Paris-Charles de Gaulle airport as he was about to board a plane leaving the country.
items.content: French authorities have made arrests in connection to the recent theft of precious jewellery from the Louvre museum in Paris, the Paris prosecutor said on Sunday. One of the suspects was arrested at Paris-Charles de Gaulle airport as he was about to board a plane leaving the country.

items.title: Prosecutor furious as news leaks of Louvre heist gang arrests
items.standfirst: Two men have been arrested following a robbery at the Louvre museum in Paris which saw thieves escape with priceless jewellery, including part of the French crown jewels.
items.content: Two men have been arrested following a robbery at the Louvre museum in Paris which saw thieves escape with priceless jewellery, including part of the French crown jewels.

items.title: Louvre moves most precious jewels out of museum for safekeeping, French media says
items.standfirst: French media reports that the Louvre has moved some of its most precious jewels out of the museum for safekeeping. The jewels were moved from the Apollo Gallery, the scene of Sunday's heist, according to French radio.
items.content: French media reports that the Louvre has moved some of its most precious jewels out of the museum for safekeeping. The jewels were moved from the Apollo Gallery, the scene of Sunday's heist, according to French radio.

ai_summary: French police arrested two men in relation to the Louvre Museum jewel heist.
The suspects were arrested on Saturday night, according to the Paris prosecutor.
One suspect was detained at Charles de Gaulle airport while attempting to leave.
The stolen items, including crown jewels, are valued at approximately €88 million.
The heist involved a team of four individuals who broke into the museum.

clusters.title: Trump raises tariffs on Canada by 10% in response to Reagan advert
clusters.neutral_headline: Trump Raises Tariffs on Canada Due to Anti-Tariff Ad
bullet_summary: Donald Trump has announced he will be raising tariffs on imports of Canadian goods by an extra 10% because of an anti-tariff advert aired in Ontario
The move comes even though Ontario's leader said the anti-tariff ad would be halted beginning Monday
Trump said that Ontario's premier didn't act quickly enough to pull the ad
Canada announced it will stop airing an ad featuring former President Reagan criticizing tariffs, after President Trump said he would cut off trade talks over the ad

items.title: Trump raises tariffs on Canada by 10% in response to Reagan advert
items.standfirst: Donald Trump has announced he will be raising tariffs on imports of Canadian goods by an extra 10% because of an anti-tariff advert aired in Ontario.
items.content: Donald Trump has announced he will be raising tariffs on imports of Canadian goods by an extra 10% because of an anti-tariff advert aired in Ontario.

items.title: Trump to increase tariffs on Canada by an additional 10 percent over anti-tariff ad
items.standfirst: US President Donald Trump said Saturday he would increase tariffs on Canadian goods by an additional 10 percent because of what he called a “fake” ad campaign paid for by the Canadian province of Ontario that featured late US president Ronald Reagan criticising the imposition of high tariffs.
items.content: US President Donald Trump said Saturday he would increase tariffs on Canadian goods by an additional 10 percent because of what he called a “fake” ad campaign paid for by the Canadian province of Ontario that featured late US president Ronald Reagan criticising the imposition of high tariffs.

items.title: Trump raises tariffs on Canadian goods over Reagan advert
items.standfirst: Saying that airing the advert was a hostile act, Trump announces an additional 10% on top of his existing levies.
items.content: Saying that airing the advert was a hostile act, Trump announces an additional 10% on top of his existing levies.

items.title: Trump threatens Canada with 10% extra import tax over anti-tariffs ad
items.standfirst: The ad, which used the words of former President Ronald Reagan to criticize U.S. tariffs, aired during a World Series game. Trump said that Ontario's premier didn't act quickly enough to pull the ad.
items.content: The ad, which used the words of former President Ronald Reagan to criticize U.S. tariffs, aired during a World Series game. Trump said that Ontario's premier didn't act quickly enough to pull the ad.(Image credit: Mark Schiefelbein)

items.title: Trump raises tariffs on Canada by 10% in retaliation for anti-tariff TV ad
items.standfirst: Move is response to ad sponsored by Ontario that referenced Ronald Reagan’s support for free tradeDonald Trump announced on Saturday that he will raise US tariffs on Canada by 10% in retaliation for an anti-tariff advertisement sponsored by the Ontario government, which has further strained one of the world’s largest trade partnerships.The statement, posted on Trump’s Truth Social account, came after several days of public disputes over the ad, which referenced Ronald Reagan’s support for free trade and provoked the US president’s anger. Continue reading...
items.content: Move is response to ad sponsored by Ontario that referenced Ronald Reagan’s support for free tradeDonald Trump announced on Saturday that he will raise US tariffs on Canada by 10% in retaliation for an anti-tariff advertisement sponsored by the Ontario government, which has further strained one of the world’s largest trade partnerships.The statement, posted on Trump’s Truth Social account, came after several days of public disputes over the ad, which referenced Ronald Reagan’s support for free trade and provoked the US president’s anger. Continue reading...

items.title: Trump to increase tariffs on Canada by 10 percent over Reagan ad
items.standfirst: US president says Ontario government's anti-tariff ad featuring Ronald Reagan needed to be taken down 'immediately'.
items.content: US president says Ontario government's anti-tariff ad featuring Ronald Reagan needed to be taken down 'immediately'.

items.title: Canada to pull tariff ad featuring Reagan
items.standfirst: Canada announced it will stop airing an ad featuring former President Reagan criticizing tariffs, after President Trump said he would cut off trade talks over the ad. NBC News’ Kelly O’Donnell reports.
items.content: Canada announced it will stop airing an ad featuring former President Reagan criticizing tariffs, after President Trump said he would cut off trade talks over the ad. NBC News’ Kelly O’Donnell reports.

items.title: US and Canada spar over ad of Reagan denouncing tariffs that led to derailed trade talks
items.standfirst: Ontario premier says he plans to run ad featuring speech that sparked Trump’s ire again during World Series but campaign will end MondayAfter the US suspended all trade negotiations with Canada over a 1987 speech by Ronald Reagan denouncing tariffs that appeared to spark Donald Trump’s ire, the premier of Ontario said he planned to run an ad featuring the speech again during the World Series on Friday.Doug Ford, whose government ran the Reagan ad in US markets this week, first posted on X that the two nations were “stronger together”, while Trump added his own string of social media posts trumpeting the supposed benefits of tariffs. Continue reading...
items.content: Ontario premier says he plans to run ad featuring speech that sparked Trump’s ire again during World Series but campaign will end MondayAfter the US suspended all trade negotiations with Canada over a 1987 speech by Ronald Reagan denouncing tariffs that appeared to spark Donald Trump’s ire, the premier of Ontario said he planned to run an ad featuring the speech again during the World Series on Friday.Doug Ford, whose government ran the Reagan ad in US markets this week, first posted on X that the two nations were “stronger together”, while Trump added his own string of social media posts trumpeting the supposed benefits of tariffs. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Donald Trump announced a 10% tariff increase on Canadian goods.
The increase is in response to an anti-tariff advertisement from Ontario.
The ad featured former President Ronald Reagan criticizing tariffs.
Ontario's premier said the ad would be halted beginning Monday.
The ad aired again during the World Series broadcast.

items.title: Trump oversees Thailand-Cambodia ceasefire signing as Asia tour gets under way
items.standfirst: Trump has begun a five-day trip to Malaysia, Japan and South Korea, his first visit to the region since taking office in JanuaryDonald Trump has overseen the signing of a ceasefire agreement between Thailand and Cambodia on the first day of an Asia tour where he will seal new trade agreements and hold a crucial meeting with Xi Jinping.The US president arrived in Malaysia on Sunday ahead of the Asean summit in the capital, Kuala Lumpur. At a ceasefire ceremony in front of a sign that read “Delivering Peace”, the Thai prime minister, Anutin Charnvirakul, and his Cambodian counterpart, Hun Manet, signed an expanded ceasefire deal related to a deadly five-day conflict in July. Continue reading...

Trump attends Thailand–Cambodia ceasefire signing in Malaysia
items.standfirst: Thailand and Cambodia signed an expanded ceasefire agreement on Sunday during a ceremony attended by US President Donald Trump, whose threats of economic pressure pushed the two nations to halt skirmishes along their disputed border earlier this year. “There are questions of just how long this peace agreement will last,” FRANCE 24’s Adam Hancock said, noting that the decades-long conflict has already seen several breaches of the ceasefire agreed in July.
items.content: Thailand and Cambodia signed an expanded ceasefire agreement on Sunday during a ceremony attended by US President Donald Trump, whose threats of economic pressure pushed the two nations to halt skirmishes along their disputed border earlier this year. “There are questions of just how long this peace agreement will last,” FRANCE 24’s Adam Hancock said, noting that the decades-long conflict has already seen several breaches of the ceasefire agreed in July.

items.title: Trump arrives in Asia with trade — and tensions with Xi — on the agenda
items.standfirst: President Donald Trump arrived in Southeast Asia on Sunday for his first visit to the continent since returning to office, a three-nation tour through Malaysia, Japan and South Korea that is expected to culminate in a meeting with Chinese President Xi Jinping, as tensions between the world’s two biggest economies tick higher.

items.title: Trump says he is open to meeting Kim Jong-un as he embarks on whirlwind Asia tour
items.standfirst: Trip will see him take part in high-stakes trade talks with Chinese leader Xi Jinping – but he also raised prospect of meeting North Korean leaderTrump in Asia: five key questions as US president prepares for diplomatic tourDonald Trump has set off for a tour of Asia where he is expected to take part in high-stakes trade talks with China’s leader, Xi Jinping – telling reporters he was also open to a meeting with the North Korean leader, Kim Jong-un.Trump, who left Washington on Friday night, is set for a five-day trip to Malaysia, Japan and South Korea, his first visit to the region since taking office in January. He is due to arrive in Malaysia on Sunday morning local time. Continue reading...
items.content: Trip will see him take part in high-stakes trade talks with Chinese leader Xi Jinping – but he also raised prospect of meeting North Korean leaderTrump in Asia: five key questions as US president prepares for diplomatic tourDonald Trump has set off for a tour of Asia where he is expected to take part in high-stakes trade talks with China’s leader, Xi Jinping – telling reporters he was also open to a meeting with the North Korean leader, Kim Jong-un.Trump, who left Washington on Friday night, is set for a five-day trip to Malaysia, Japan and South Korea, his first visit to the region since taking office in January. He is due to arrive in Malaysia on Sunday morning local time. Continue reading...

The U.S. is seeking support to pressure China on trade and minerals.

items.title: US places sanctions on Colombian president over alleged failure to stop cartels
items.standfirst: Treasury accuses Gustavo Petro of ‘allowing drug cartels to flourish’ as president attacks Trump’s ‘oppressive regime’The US treasury department has announced sanctions on Colombian president Gustavo Petro, one of Donald Trump’s harshest international critics.“President Petro has allowed drug cartels to flourish and refused to stop this activity,” treasury secretary Scott Bessent wrote in a post on X. “Today President Trump is taking strong action to protect our nation.” Continue reading...

clusters.title: A Single Point of Failure Triggered the Amazon Outage Affecting Million
clusters.neutral_headline: Amazon Outage Caused by Single Point of Failure
bullet_summary: Reported by Reuters Top News, Ars Technica News

items.title: A Single Point of Failure Triggered the Amazon Outage Affecting Million
items.standfirst: An anonymous reader quotes a report from Ars Technica: The outage that hit Amazon Web Services and took out vital services worldwide was the result of a single failure that cascaded from system to system within Amazon's sprawling network, according to a post-mortem from company engineers. [...]…
items.content: An anonymous reader quotes a report from Ars Technica: The outage that hit Amazon Web Services and took out vital services worldwide was the result of a single failure that cascaded from system to system within Amazon's sprawling network, according to a post-mortem from company engineers. [...]…

items.title: A single point of failure triggered the Amazon outage affecting millions
items.standfirst: A DNS manager in a single region of Amazon's sprawling network touched off a 16-hour debacle.
items.content: The outage that hit Amazon Web Services and took out vital services worldwide was the result of a single failure that cascaded from system to system within Amazon’s sprawling network, according to a post-mortem from company engineers. The series of failures lasted for 15 hours and 32 minutes, Amazon said. Network intelligence company Ookla said its DownDetector service received more than 17 million reports of disrupted services offered by 3,500 organizations. The three biggest countries where reports originated were the US, the UK, and Germany. Snapchat, AWS, and Roblox were the most reported services affected. Ookla said the event was “among the largest internet outages on record for Downdetector.” It’s always DNS Amazon said the root cause of the outage was a software bug in software running the DynamoDB DNS management system. The system monitors the stability of load balancers by, among other things, periodically creating new DNS configurations for endpoints within the AWS network. A race condition is an error that makes a process dependent on the timing or sequence events that are variable and outside the developers’ control. The result can be unexpected behavior and potentially harmful failures.Read full article Comments

ai_summary: A single failure triggered the Amazon Web Services outage.
The outage affected vital services worldwide.
The failure cascaded through Amazon's network.
The outage lasted for approximately 16 hours.
The failure originated in a DNS manager.

clusters.neutral_headline: Catherine Connolly Wins Irish Presidential Election
bullet_summary: Connolly, 68, said Saturday evening at Dublin Castle that she would champion diversity and be a voice for peace and one that “builds on our policy of neutrality
Reported by France24, BBC World

items.title: Left-winger Catherine Connolly wins Irish presidency
items.standfirst: Left-wing independent Catherine Connolly, who secured the backing of Ireland's left-leaning parties including Sinn Féin, has won the country's presidential election in a landslide victory against her centre-right rival. Connolly, 68, said Saturday evening at Dublin Castle that she would champion diversity and be a voice for peace and one that “builds on our policy of neutrality.”
items.content: Left-wing independent Catherine Connolly, who secured the backing of Ireland's left-leaning parties including Sinn Féin, has won the country's presidential election in a landslide victory against her centre-right rival. Connolly, 68, said Saturday evening at Dublin Castle that she would champion diversity and be a voice for peace and one that “builds on our policy of neutrality.”

items.title: Do populists always crash the economy?
items.standfirst: Argentina is counting the cost of its turn to Javier Milei. Politicians from Donald Trump to Giorgia Meloni and Nigel Farage will be closely watching what happens next“Cambio, cambio.” Under the blazing sun, dozens of money changers are hawking US dollars along Florida Street, a bustling pedestrian strip in Buenos Aires. Known as arbolitos (“little trees”), they are thriving ahead of the 26 October midterm elections in a country long used to saving in the greenback.“The best time to buy is now,” says one arbolito, declining to give her name. “[The dollar] went down a little but it is a fake-out – it’ll rise again.” Continue reading...
items.content: Argentina is counting the cost of its turn to Javier Milei. Politicians from Donald Trump to Giorgia Meloni and Nigel Farage will be closely watching what happens next“Cambio, cambio.” Under the blazing sun, dozens of money changers are hawking US dollars along Florida Street, a bustling pedestrian strip in Buenos Aires. Known as arbolitos (“little trees”), they are thriving ahead of the 26 October midterm elections in a country long used to saving in the greenback.“The best time to buy is now,” says one arbolito, declining to give her name. “[The dollar] went down a little but it is a fake-out – it’ll rise again.” Continue reading...

ai_summary: Argentina is assessing the economic impact of Javier Milei's policies.
Politicians are watching Argentina's situation closely.

clusters.title: Tax rises could push food prices higher, warn supermarkets
clusters.neutral_headline: Supermarkets Warn of Potential Food Price Increases
bullet_summary: Reported by Reuters Top News, BBC Top Stories

items.title: Tax rises could push food prices higher, warn supermarkets
items.standfirst: Tax rises could push food prices higher, warn supermarkets The bosses of Britain's biggest supermarkets have warned food prices could rise even further if higher taxes are imposed on the sector. Grocers including Tesco, Asda, Sainsbury's and Morrisons signed a letter to Chancellor Rachel Reeves…
items.content: Tax rises could push food prices higher, warn supermarkets The bosses of Britain's biggest supermarkets have warned food prices could rise even further if higher taxes are imposed on the sector. Grocers including Tesco, Asda, Sainsbury's and Morrisons signed a letter to Chancellor Rachel Reeves…

items.title: Tax rises could push food prices higher, warn supermarkets
items.standfirst: The bosses of the UK's largest supermarkets warn the chancellor against imposing higher taxes on the industry.
items.content: The bosses of the UK's largest supermarkets warn the chancellor against imposing higher taxes on the industry.

ai_summary: Supermarkets warn of potential food price increases.
Tax rises could push food prices higher.
The bosses of major supermarkets signed a letter.
The letter was addressed to Chancellor Rachel Reeves.
The articles are from Reuters and BBC.

clusters.title: 'I'm not done', Kamala Harris tells the BBC's Laura Kuenssberg
clusters.neutral_headline: Kamala Harris Hints at Another Presidential Run
bullet_summary: Reported by BBC World, CBS News

items.title: 'I'm not done', Kamala Harris tells the BBC's Laura Kuenssberg
items.standfirst: The former vice president made her strongest suggestion to date that she will make another presidential bid in 2028 - after losing to Donald Trump last year.
items.content: The former vice president made her strongest suggestion to date that she will make another presidential bid in 2028 - after losing to Donald Trump last year.

items.title: Kamala Harris leaves the door open for another presidential run
items.standfirst: Former vice president Kamala Harris spoke about the possibility of a woman being in the White House one day in an interview with the BBC.
items.content: Former vice president Kamala Harris spoke about the possibility of a woman being in the White House one day in an interview with the BBC.

ai_summary: Kamala Harris suggests another presidential bid.
She made the statement in a BBC interview.
She lost to Donald Trump in the previous election.
The articles are from BBC and CBS News.
The articles discuss her future plans.

clusters.title: Trump may have another motive in extreme war on drugs escalation
clusters.neutral_headline: US Sends Aircraft Carrier to Caribbean Region
bullet_summary: The Trump administration announced it will send an aircraft carrier towards Latin America in a major escalation of its war on drug cartels
Reported by Sky News World, NBC World

items.title: Trump may have another motive in extreme war on drugs escalation
items.standfirst: The world's largest aircraft carrier is steaming towards the Caribbean supported by the rest of its "carrier group" to add even more muscle to the US forces already threateningly close to Venezuela.
items.content: The world's largest aircraft carrier is steaming towards the Caribbean supported by the rest of its "carrier group" to add even more muscle to the US forces already threateningly close to Venezuela.

items.title: U.S to send aircraft carrier to Caribbean
items.standfirst: The Trump administration announced it will send an aircraft carrier towards Latin America in a major escalation of its war on drug cartels. NBC News’ Courtney Kube reports.
items.content: The Trump administration announced it will send an aircraft carrier towards Latin America in a major escalation of its war on drug cartels. NBC News’ Courtney Kube reports.

ai_summary: The US is sending an aircraft carrier to the Caribbean.
The carrier is part of a drug war escalation.
The carrier group is supporting the effort.
The articles are from Sky News and NBC.
The articles discuss the US's actions.
